data.job_description:
Fecha: 25 nov 2025

Ubicación

M, ES

Empresa: PUBLIESPAÑA S.A.U.

Publiespaña, líder del mercado publicitario nacional, es la compañía que gestiona comercialmente todos los soportes de Mediaset España: sus canales de televisión Telecinco, Cuatro, FDF, Divinity, Energy, Be Mad y Boing, con sus correspondientes sites en Internet; la plataforma digital de contenidos Mitele, el canal de vídeos exclusivos digitales Mtmad, así como Nius y el site deportivo El Desmarque.

Actualmente, buscamos un Analista de Marketing con sólida experiencia en análisis de audiencias tanto de televisión como digital. Trabajará dentro del área de Marketing Operativo apoyando en la elaboración de informes, análisis estratégicos y argumentarios comerciales para peticiones internacionales de Italia.

Funciones principales
• Analizar datos de audiencias de televisión y digital para generar insights que apoyen las estrategias comerciales y de marketing.
• Elaborar informes, presentaciones y argumentarios utilizando datos procedentes de diversas fuentes de medición.
• Interpretar datos de consumo audiovisual y de comportamiento digital para identificar tendencias de mercado.
• Mantener actualizadas las bases de datos internas y coordinarse con distintas áreas.
• Aportar recomendaciones basadas en datos para mejorar la eficacia de campañas y acciones comerciales.

Requisitos técnicos
• Experiencia sólida en análisis de audiencias de televisión y digital (al menos 6 años)
• Conocimientos de medición digital y análisis de datos procedentes de plataformas online (Adobe Analytics, Comscore y GfK DAM).
• Manejo profesional de Instar Analytics (Kantar Media).
• Nivel avanzado de paquete Office (Word, Power Point y Excel).

Experiencia y formación
• Experiencia de al menos 6 años en roles relacionados con análisis de audiencias, investigación de medios, marketing o planificación en medios.
• Muy valorable experiencia previa en medios de comunicación o agencias.
• Formación en Marketing, Publicidad, Comunicación, ADE, Estadística o similar
• Alto nivel en idioma inglés. C1

¿Qué ofrecemos?
• Condiciones salariales adaptadas a tu perfil, compuestas por un salario fijo y un salario variable.
• Otros beneficios de compañía tales como: entorno de trabajo híbrido, seguro médico, comedor de empresa, retribución flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y meses de verano.

Publiespaña mantiene su compromiso y responsabilidad con la igualdad de oportunidades y su lucha contra la discriminación en cualquier de sus formas. Por ello, se valorarán en el proceso a todos los solicitantes que cumplan con los requisitos solicitados independientemente de su condición.

**TOMO - The World Finest Luxury Water Bottle**

Founded in 2020, TOMO has established itself as a leading luxury drinkware brand, which is focused on impeccable craftsmanship and outstanding design.
• *Calling all CRO ANALYSTS! \uD83C\uDF1F**

Here's your opportunity to be part of a global team of passionate marketers, artists, designers, product specialists, and visionaries who are working towards creating a more positive life on this planet. At TOMO, we focus on wellness, sustainability, the love for design, and building purpose-driven brands.
• *Here’s what you’ll get to do**:

- Analyzing website and marketing data to identify revenue growth opportunities.
- Prioritizing optimization areas to improve the online shopping experience.
- Conducting A/B tests, interpreting results, and making data-driven recommendations.
- Collaborating with development and design teams to implement changes.
- Staying current with industry trends and best practices in e-commerce optimization.
- Developing and executing a testing roadmap to measure impact on revenue.
- Identifying opportunities for automation to streamline optimization efforts.
- Managing and prioritizing multiple projects based on potential revenue impact.
• *To succeed in this role, you should have**:

- 2-3 years of experience in e-commerce optimization, A/B testing, or web analytics.
- Proficiency in Google Analytics, Optimizely, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and SQL.
- Strong analytical and communication skills.
- Creative thinking and attention to detail.
- Adaptability to changing business needs.

If you’re ready to take your e-commerce career to the next level and join a dynamic, forward-thinking team, don’t wait any longer.

Groupon is a marketplace where customers discover new experiences and services everyday and local businesses thrive. To date we have worked with over a million merchant partners worldwide, connecting over 16 million customers with deals across various categories. In a world often dominated by e-commerce giants, we stand out as one of the few platforms uniquely committed to helping local businesses succeed on a performance basis.

Groupon is on a radical journey to transform our business with relentless pursuit of results. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. The impact here can be immediate due to our scale and the speed of our transformation. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact.

Help shape the strategy behind the deals people love ️

Groupon's Commercial Finance & Strategy team is looking for a curious, data-loving, marketing-savvy human to join us at the intersection of Marketing, Supply, and Market Operations. In this role, you'll make sure our marketing plans actually match what's happening in the real world—what's in stock, what's trending, what's performing—and help connect customers with the right offers at the right time.

If you're early in your career, fluent in marketing metrics, strong in SQL ️, and excited to turn insights into real impact… this is your playground.

What you'll do
• Be the go-to supply partner for Marketing and Market Managers—align campaign calendars with what audiences want, what merchants are ready for, and what's happening in each market
• Build and maintain SQL-powered reporting that keeps a pulse on campaign and supply health (selection depth, competitiveness, content quality, ROAS, CAC, AOV… all the greatest hits)
• Dig into funnel performance and marketplace trends to uncover patterns, spot gaps, and turn "hmm interesting…" into "here's exactly what we should do next"
• Keep up with marketing trends, attribution changes, platform updates, and AI workflows—and translate them into experiments, playbooks, and better ways of working
• Partner with Market Managers, Channel teams, Ops, Product, CRM, and Finance to share insights, align priorities, and bring cross-functional magic to life ✨
• Help shape quarterly and annual plans by sizing opportunities, setting KPIs, and connecting marketing investment to business outcomes
• Hunt down process bottlenecks and automation opportunities—then help build the solutions that remove them

About you
• 3+ years in marketing analytics, growth, marketplace ops, or a similar analytical role
• You speak fluent marketing metrics—CAC, CPC, ROAS, CVR, AOV, retention, selection coverage, and more
• SQL is a must: you're comfortable querying large datasets, joining tables, using window functions, and delivering clean, trustworthy data
• Strong Excel/Sheets skills; visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio) are a bonus
• Familiar with analytics and tracking tools like GA/GA4, ad platforms, UTMs, MMPs, and GMP. Salesforce experience is a plus
• Naturally curious, detail-oriented, and always looking for smarter, faster, more automated ways to get things done
• A clear communicator who can turn deep analysis into simple stories and actionable next steps
• A team player who's just as comfortable working solo on a problem as collaborating across teams
• Fluent in English (spoken and written)

Groupon is an AI-First Company

We're committed to building smarter, faster, and more innovative ways of working—and AI plays a key role in how we get there. We encourage candidates to leverage AI tools during the hiring process where it adds value, and we're always keen to hear how technology improves the way you work. If you're passionate about AI or curious to explore how it can elevate your role—you'll be right at home here.

Groupon's purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world's largest local e-commerce marketplace, click here. You can also find out more about us in the latest Groupon news as well as learning about our DEI approach. If all of this sounds like something that's a great fit for you, then click apply and join us on a mission to become the ultimate destination for local experiences and services.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud: Groupon follows a merit-based recruitment process without charging job seekers any fees. We've noticed an increase in recruitment fraud, including fake job postings and fraudulent interviews and job offers aimed at stealing personal information or money. Be cautious of individuals falsely representing Groupon's Talent Acquisition team with fake job offers. If you encounter any suspicious job offers or interview calls demanding money, recognize these as scams. Groupon is not responsible for losses from such dealings. For legitimate job openings (and a sneak peek into life at Groupon), always check our official career website at Groupon Careers

Business Department: Fundraising & Investor Relations

Employment type: Full-time

Start date: As soon as possible

Blue Earth Capital

Blue Earth Capital (BlueEarth) is a global, independent impact investment firm headquartered in Switzerland, with offices in New York, London, and Konstanz, and soon in Madrid. Blue Earth Capital seeks to address the world’s most pressing social and environmental challenges by delivering measurable impact alongside aiming for attractive and market-rate financial returns. The company operates dedicated private equity, private credit, and fund solutions as well as separately managed accounts. Blue Earth Capital is owned by the Blue Earth Foundation, a Stiftung (charity/trust) registered in Switzerland that focuses on deep impact to support initiatives and business ventures to help deliver a more equitable and sustainable future.

What it's about

In this position, you are part of BlueEarth’s Marketing & Client Support team, which is the client excellence unit of our Fundraising & Investor Relations team. As part of the role, you support portfolio managers and fundraisers with client requests, marketing initiatives, corporate communication, and event coordination. Your primary tasks include:
• Creating tailored, persuasive, and high-quality responses to client requests, assisting with queries and performance updates
• Creating convincing, high-quality marketing presentations and investment proposals
• Organizing internal and external events
• Creating and developing high-quality, engaging content for different platforms
• Leading/supporting the on-boarding process for clients
• Ad-hoc projects as required

We are looking for highly motivated, proactive candidates who are purpose-driven, willing to go the extra mile, and bring own ideas. You will be part of a growing team and support us in servicing our growing client base and elevating the public profile of Blue Earth Capital. Key attributes include:
• 2-3 years relevant work experience ideally in investor relations,, fundraising, and/or corporate communication/financial PR
• A genuine passion for impact investing, previous experience in the sector is a plus
• At least undergraduate university degree
• Ability and willingness to take ownership and responsibility
• Quick learner with proactive mindset
• Love for content and compelling visuals combined with natural attention to detail
• Analytical skills with a spark of creativity
• Willingness to work towards tight deadlines
• Analytical skills with a spark of creativity
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint and Excel
• Excellent command of both spoken and written English, professional working proficiency in German is highly desirable
• Valid work permit is required for the location you are applying for
• Spanish / EU work permit

What we offer

Blue Earth Capital is a global investment firm focused on creating measurable impact whilst delivering market-

based returns with the pace and entrepreneurialism of a growing team. We offer the following:
• Join a growing team, taking care of a growing number of institutional and professional clients
• Career opportunity in a global, dynamic, and client-oriented environment
• Opportunity to deepen your knowledge within private market impact investing
• Growth-oriented entrepreneurial culture with significant development opportunities
• Blue Earth Capital is an equal opportunity employer committed to cultural diversity

data.job_title: Marketing Data Analyst: Drive Data-Driven Growth
data.job_description:
A leading mobility services company in Madrid is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to enhance marketing analytics capabilities. This role involves data analysis, SQL proficiency, and collaboration with engineering teams. The ideal candidate should have a graduate degree in relevant fields and experience in digital marketing. The position offers excellent salary conditions and a hybrid working model with ample personal development opportunities.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

data.job_title: Senior Performance Marketing Analyst (Italian Speaker) - Remote
data.job_description: A leading travel technology company is seeking a Senior Performance Marketing Analyst (Italian Speaker) to join its Customer Acquisition team. This role involves defining marketing strategies based on data insights, supervising reporting, and collaborating with various teams to optimize performance in a remote working environment. Ideal candidates will have a strong background in data analysis and marketing, along with communication skills in Italian.#J-18808-Ljbffr

Within the ROLE you will have to perform different activities, analysis and proposals for the acquisition of new users, have fluency in the use of Excel and analytical tools, as well as benchmarking and studies of other ecommerce platforms from which to draw insights and best practices to update.
This role will also have to help with the monitoring and measurement of new evolutions and developments that are made in our marketplace, and work on activations with the marketing, design or product teams to achieve efficiency and profitability of the channels and pages of our site.
For this role it is important to have an analytical, proactive and creative profile, who adapts quickly to changes and likes to execute and perform detailed analysis and plan to obtain insights that help us develop hypotheses for improvement.
• *Responsibilities**:

- On-site channel management (e.g. banners governance & scheduling, daily deals channel, new arrival channel, etc.) to maximize customer interest and sales.
- Perform analysis of the data provided.
- Update dashboards or excel template to support decision making.
- Competitive analysis and market research.
- Provide benchmarks for onsite new user acquisition and web experience improvement.
- Responsible for operational processes.
• *Requirements**:

- Strong academic record with a bachelor degree or above.
- 1 or more years of experience either in business, growth, marketing or similar departments in ecommerce.
- Proficient command of Excel and PowerPoint.
- Understands data analysis and the different metrics used.
- Pays attention to detail and proofreads documents before submitting them.
- Strong communication skill, able to work with and manage various stakeholders.
- Ability to think outside the box and come up with new ideas.
- Native Spanish speaker, fluent in English (able to work in an English-speaking environment).
- Location: in Spain.
• *Benefits**:

- Full time position (39h per week, Monday to Friday).
- Salary: 20.000€ gross/year + up to 3.000€ gross/year in bonus
- Referral Program: Bring a Friend and get a Referral fee (up to 2.000€ depending on the language/project)
- Permanent Contract.
- Employment with the world's largest provider of contact center services.
- Excellent work environment, great colleagues, social arrangements and personal development.
• *Job Types**: Full-time, Permanent

Work Location: In person
Analista de marketing enfocado en investigación de mercado, generación de demanda y habilitación comercial en ambiente B2B, con experiencia en sector ingredientes/cosmética.

**Descripción**:
• *¡Súmate a la 4ª revolución tecnológica!**

En Global Alumni, la primera EdTech euroamericana, hemos conseguido derribar las fronteras físicas y del idioma, acercando el conocimiento y el prestigio de las mejores universidades y escuelas de negocios del mundo a cualquier profesional en un entorno digital, globalizado y en continuo cambio.

Ofrecemos a las universidades la gestión integral de sus programas de posgrado en modalidad online y semipresencial. Nos encargamos del diseño y el lanzamiento de las campañas de marketing, la elaboración del contenido digital de los programas formativos y la gestión académica. Todo ello en seis idiomas y en un entorno multicultural.

Global Alumni está en plena expansión. Como parte de este crecimiento, buscamos un **Data Analyst & Marketing Intelligence Manager.**
• *Responsabilidades**:

- Dirigir y gestionar el equipo de análisis de datos (área marketing y ventas) para impulsar la generación de ideas y la ejecución de estrategias efectivas.
- Desarrollar e implementar estrategias de recopilación, análisis y visualización de datos para informar las decisiones de marketing.
- Crear y mantener dashboards y reportes personalizados para monitorizar KPIs clave.
- Utilizar herramientas avanzadas de análisis de datos y machine learning para identificar insights y oportunidades de optimización en las campañas de marketing.
- Desarrollar modelos predictivos y realizar análisis predictivos para respaldar iniciativas comerciales.
- Colaborar estrechamente con los equipos de marketing para definir objetivos, KPIs y métricas de éxito para las campañas.
- Realizar análisis de mercado y competencia para informar las estrategias de posicionamiento y diferenciación de la marca.
- Monitorizar el rendimiento de las campañas de marketing y proporcionar informes periódicos con recomendaciones para la mejora continua.
- Mantenerse al tanto de las últimas tendencias y mejores prácticas en análisis de datos y marketing digital.
- Proponer mejoras en los procesos y herramientas de análisis de datos para optimizar la eficiencia y la efectividad.
- 60% del tiempo trabajando con las plataformas y las BBDD y el 40% coordinando equipo y trabajando para el negocio.
• *Requisitos**:
• *Requisitos**:

- Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o un campo relacionado.
- Experiência previa en análisis de datos y marketing digital, preferiblemente en un rol de liderazgo.
- Fuerte habilidad para manejar herramientas de análisis de datos como Tableau, SqL, Big Query, Salesforce, Python, así como plataformas de marketing digital como Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc
- Valorable: Experiência con Salesfore.
- Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita, con capacidad para presentar información compleja de manera clara y concisa.
- Mindset orientado a negocio.
- Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y en equipo, gestionar múltiples tareas y cumplir con plazos ajustados.
- Orientado a resultados, con capacidad para gestionar múltiples proyectos y cumplir con plazos ajustados.
- Nível alto de inglés (C1+/C2).
• *¿Las ventajas de trabajar en Global Alumni?**
- Contrato indefinido.
- Presencial en nuestras oficinas de Mendez Alvaro.
- 23 días de vacaciones para desconectar.
- Respeto absoluto por tus horas de descanso: ¡aquí no se hacen horas extras! Tu tarde, es tuya.
- Horario flexible: si no te gusta madrugar, o necesitas conciliar, tienes flexibilidad en la entrada y la salida (8:00 a 10:00) y de (17:30 a 19h30), cada día, adapta tu horario a tu medida.
- Excelente ambiente de trabajo, donde en poco tiempo estarás trabajando no solo con compañeros, sino con amigos.
- Parking gratuito.

The Company

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

Job Description

lastminute.com is looking for a Senior Performance Marketing Analyst to play a crucial role into the Customer Acquisition inside the Marketing department. We are looking for a professional who is a data lover, a bit obsessed by data driven approach and capable of understanding the dynamic of both, marketing and data departments.

The Job In Brief

Job Title - Senior Performance Marketing Analyst

Working model - remote from Spain

Team - you will join the Customer Acquisition team within the Marketing department.

Level - individual contributor

Location - Spain

Contract - Permanent – full-time (EUR 36 h/wee)

What Your Impact Will Be
• Proactively define and review an overarching marketing strategy, based on data&insights, aligned with our company business goals, identifying areas for optimization and experimentation that can drive incremental gains in our marketing effectiveness and efficiency.
• Supervise the reporting for the Customer Acquisition departments in order to have the hands on the main marketing channel every day, communicating effectively performance trends and insights to the manager.
• Collaborate closely with Data&Analytics team, to ensure alignment and coherence of overall data initiatives. It’s fundamental to understand the DB structure and the dynamics in order to extract and analyse, also if they could come from various sources including digital marketing platforms, website analytics, and third-party data.
• Partner with our marketing teams inside and outside the Customer Acquisition department, create a strong connection with SEM, SEO and Display teams offering the proper support in setting the marketing strategy, based on analytics.
• Create a similar connection with the other marketing teams not in the Customer Acquisition department, in order to understand if and how “external factors” can affect the overall performance
• Stay abreast of emerging trends, best practices, and innovations in marketing analytics and technology to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation.
